context: The Finnish word 'tahtoa' is the basic form of the verb meaning 'to want' or 'to wish'. It's used to express a desire or willingness for something. In the present tense, it often appears as 'tahdon' (I want) and in past tense as 'tahtoi' (he/she/it wanted). This is one of the most fundamental verbs in Finnish for expressing personal desires.
